column4: 255 E Basse Rd Ste 940 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: The food is hit and miss. The duck confit salad is great, but the venison chop was a bit over cooked. In general everything was a bit salty. The wine options are great as well as the after dinner wines.

column4: 146 East Houston San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Service was great. Menu was interesting.....baby goat, roasted pork, grilled meat platter, exellent ,very good food value. Drinks fresh great Maragritas

column4: 600 E. Market St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was very good. But I had gone there for a Mexican type of meal, which they had little to offer.

column4: 8539 Fredericksburg Rd San Antonio, TX  78229
column13: Aldo's has great food, service and ambiance and is definitely one of the best Italian restaurants in S.A.

column4: 9800 Hyatt Resort Drive San Antonio, TX  78251
column13: Outstanding menu and service. i had an interesting dessert - a beer float - vanilla bean ice cream with Shiners Black lager.

column4: 106 River Walk San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Quiet place for a anniversary meal for two. Piono player whos willing to take request and fun to sing along with. Enjoyed it. Would recommend for a couples night out.

column4: 203 S. St. Mary's St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Amazing as usual! Great food and great service, a wonderful combination. Always trying to figure out where to eat downtown and keep coming back to Biga-for good reason.

column4: 926 S Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78210
column13: We went to Bliss on Saturday evening at 6 pm on the reference of a friend. We were very happy with the food and service. We will definitely be back.

column4: 219 East Houston Street Suite 275 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: i made reservations here based on a friends opinion of the steak, although i am not a big steak eater i thought i would appreciate an excellant steak here, but that was not the case. The steak i ordered was my least favorite during my meal. I thought i would be "wowed" by it,but it had little flavor although it was cooked to my specifications. Was dissapointed, but was thrilled with the salad and complimentary champayne for my dinner guests birthday and the candied jalapeno was awesome and i bought 5 jars to gift to my family for Christmas!! That item will be an online purchase in the future when i run out of my own personal jar!! The staff was excellant and our waiter, Ryan, was delightful and energetic and very informative about SA!

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Typical Texas hotel food, except probably pricier since it's a Westin.

column4: 5011 Broadway San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: food and service was great. Karen did a great job.

column1: Chart House Restaurant - Tower of the Americas
column4: 601 Tower of the Americas Way San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The elevator ride was nice but crowded. The views in the restaurant were fabulous especially with the added feature of a revolving floor. I would enjoyed the food more if it was not lukewarm. Overall, The experience was enjoyable.

column4: 150 East Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Really a well-designed and fantastically comfortable restaurant with a great creative menu with amazing never-before-tasted flavor combos!

column4: 18740 Stone Oak Parkway San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: With all I had read about Drew's I was expecting an outstanding treat. The food was good but not outstanding. When I take the time and money to go out to eat I want something I can't prepare at home. My husband and I had the prime rib. Mine was good but his was tough. He said he should have sent it back but didn't want the trouble of doing that. The macaroni and cheese was bland. Nothing special for us.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - San Antonio
column4: 255 East Basse Road Suite 200 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: always wanted to go to flemings. went to celebrate 2nd anniversary. amazing to say the least. everyone was awesome and the food was great.

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Always a pleasant experience. The service is impeccable. The food is always excellent. We did have one experience when there was too much time between courses. Otherwise the timing is usually good to be able to savor the experience of each course.

column4: 14439 NW Military Highway Suite 100 San Antonio, TX  78231
column13: Another wonderful dinner at Frederick's Bistro!

column4: 24116 IH10 W San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: The food & service were outstanding

column4: 2360 Gruene Lake Dr New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: We ate at The druene Door before a night at Gruene Hall recently and really liked it. Quality food, reasonable prices and very good service!

column4: 3259 Wurzbach Rd San Antonio, TX  78238
column13: My husband and I enjoyed our meal. Great little quaint place. Very attentive staff.Will be back in the future!!!!!!Thanks for a great meal:)

column4: 23808 Resort Parkway San Antonio, TX  78261
column13: 18 Oaks has a wonderful atmosphere, a great menu and good service, also excellent outdoor views and interesting decor.We were a bit disappointed that on a quiet Sunday night (they were not too busy) that our dinners took a long time to get to our table. However overall service was good. Two of our party loved their meals, however the other two of us had the Ahi Tuna special, which was very un-exciting, and served not as described by our waiter. It was a disappointment considering the cost of the meal.

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - Cibolo Moon
column4: 23808 Resort Parkway San Antonio, TX  23808
column13: Food was not prepared as described on menu...a problem for those with food allergies! We were disappointed along several dimensions, but this place has a captive audience and little competition to force them to be better. All in all, even ignoring our problems with miscommunications over food allergies, I would call it much-overpriced for what you get, and what you get is really not that great.

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - High Velocity
column4: 23808 Resort Pkwy San Antonio, TX  78261
column13: We were just going to eat & have some drinks, then the Hostess let me know about a Special Beer Pairing Dinner. So glad she did. We had a group of 6 & we all had a Fabulous time! We will definitely be going again! Thanks!

column4: 123 N. Loop 1604 San Antonio, TX  78232
column13: Really good steaks, awesome staff, nice ambiance.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway The Shops At La Cantera San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Great place, excellent service, and affordable menu!

column4: 3500 Island Moorings Pkwy Port Aransas, TX  78373
column13: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at La Barataria. Service was excellent, not rushed, but always attentive. Had a nice glass of wine that was recommended by our waiter. The bread basket was delicious, especially with the roasted garlic. Also ordered the olives and there was plenty to take home w us. Our entrees were the snapper and lobster cake, both delicious. The view was beautiful, we will return for sure!

column1: La Cascada - The Resort at Tapatio Springs
column4: 314 Blue Heron Blvd. Boerne, TX  78006
column13: We celebrated our anniversary at La Cascada and had a wonderful time. The food was excellent and the vie outstanding.

column4: 2415 N. Main Ave San Antonio, TX  78212
column13: Best Fish Tacos ever. My wife enjoyed the Nopalitos "Prickly Pear Pad" strips. Great Margaritas. Always come here when come to visit family. Thanks for the beautiful postcard also.

column4: 112 College Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: It is not possible to receive better service than was provided at Las Canarias, we felt like we were dining with friends. It is also incredibly romantic.

column4: 306 West Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: We have been to Las Ramblas several times before and have thoroughly enjoyed their tapas menu. I chose to go there for my 65th birthday; even though we live 65 miles away. Normally we eat there when we have visitors from the Northeast, after showing them the Alamo, and the Riverwalk. It tells them that there is sophistication to be had in what they presume is the vast wasteland of Texas.We have been to Barcelona numerous times, and lived off Tapas. Those at Las Ramblas are authentic, and just as good.

column4: 200 N. Seguin Ave. New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: Both the staff and the food were great.

column4: 3610 Avenue B San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Not sure why you need a reservation. No wait service. No alcohol lisense. Should have advertised that Saturday is only pizza night. Very disorganized at register where you have to order your food and pay in advance. Not a very good way to run a business. Very poor mom and pop operation. They didnt even acknowledge our reservation but again why even make one it certainly wasnt necessary. This was a special birthday that was ruined. :(

column4: 11255 Huebner Rd San Antonio, TX  78230
column13: Absolutely fabulous and reasonably-priced food!

column4: 125 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: For a Friday night, the place was almost empty inside and with few tables outside. Service was forgettable and clumsy. An assistant waiter had to supplement the forgetfulness of our initial assigned waiter. Food was fair. Undeserved applause for chef of fame in Louisiana for almost nothing in San Antonio. Misleading advertisement.Will not recommend!

column4: 17603 Interstate I-10 W San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: The General Manager came over to talk with us, as he remembered us from a previous visit. He is awesome! Our food came on time and was tasty. I had Shrimp Scampi and although it was fine, I think it was a bit too oily and I would have preferred to have the Linguine with garlic and shrimp instead. Unfortunately, I didn't see that on the menu, just on the family style menu. The waitress recommended that we split our dessert (warm cake w/sauce and bananas) which we took "to go." When we got home, we realized the cake slice was actually small to regular sized and that it wasn't worth splitting. The cake was dry too. As always, we had to pack up the remainder of our food because it was too much (but that's a good thing).

column4: 340 East Basse Road, Suite 101 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Great ambiance...good food...excellent service. Very relaxed without compromising a chic & modern feel. Kudos to Max's Wine Dive!

column4: 14855 Blanco Rd,  Suite 110 San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: Best eating experience ever. Will recommend to all my friends and family.

column4: 300 E. Crockett Street Suite 283 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The staff made our Anniversary dinner special. The food was excellent, and the service was superb. The mixed grill combined a succulent filet with delicious shrimp and bacon-wrapped scallops. The concept of sharing side dishes is a fantastic idea. Dessert was fantastic, and the staff even provided a free photo to commemorate the evening.

column4: 10003 NW Military Hwy, Ste 2101 San Antonio, TX  78231
column13: The service was outstanding. The waiter made excellent suggestions on the menu and was very attentive. Food was good and served in style. The bread pudding was the best I have ever tasted. Perfect place for a special occasion date since it was our anniversary. Look forward to our next visit.

column4: 136 N Castell New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: Rivals the top dollar places and beats most of them. Prices are reasonable for excellent, well-prepared food. Everything was cooked perfectly to our order and the wait staff kept checking if the food was to our liking, if we required anything at the time, etc. We have dined here before and Myron's offerings,ambiance, and selection are perfect for any occasion. Highly recommended.

column4: 312 Pearl Parkway Bldg 2 Suite 2102 San Antonio, TX  78215
column13: Wonderful restaurant. The staff is very friendly, food was amazing, and the price was very reasonable. We will definitely be back again soon. I live the way the menu is setup. It allows you to try a lot if different items without the worry of having a bunch of wasted food and money.

column1: Oro at The Emily Morgan Hotel
column4: 705 E Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: I've been to Oro several times, but its been a while. The quality just wasn't the same as I remembered. I'm not sure if there is a different chef but I was not pleased. I will try it again and if its better I will submit an update.

column4: 212 W. Crockett St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Food was excellent! Great service. Will recommend to friends and will go back.

column4: 1401 N Loop 1604 W Suite 105 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Although it was very good, it was not as good as the last time I went. Maybe it was the night of the week. It was almost too quiet. The steak was good, but I have had better on other visits. The Mac & cheese was great!

column4: 233 East Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Having dinner at The Palm San Antonio is like having dinner with family.

column4: 5800 Broadway San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Tres Leches cake is the best in the city! Love this place and its neighborhood feel. No tourists, great service and house specials make it unique.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Suite 22200 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Overall great experience. The one thing I did not like is that we sat there for a very long time intially before our waitress coming to our table, and it took too long to order drinks, and get bread!

column4: 255 East Basse Street San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Food and service were acceptable, but the noise level was not. This is not atypical for San Antonio restaurants, but being able to hear dining companions is important to me.

column1: Q on the Riverwalk - Hyatt Regency
column4: 123 Losoya St San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Had jalapeno poppers and asian ribs appetizers -- very good. Had the brisket and steak entrees -- not. The brisket was undercooked so the fat had not melded with the meat: once you trimmed to thick slab of fat from each slice the meat was chewy and a bit dry. The steak was not a good grade of meat: it was cooked properly but just wasn't tender or juicy. Any BB"Q" place in Texas needs top notch meat. The restaurant is a nice place but pretty standard decor-wise, and for a Saturday night it was empty. The hostess hardly greeted us but our waiter was excellent and the chef visited our table, too.

column4: 152 E. Pecan, #100 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was amazing as usual. The service was good. It is always a pleasure to dine in this restaurant. :)

column4: 1806 NW Loop 1604 San Antonio, TX  78248
column13: My girlfriend and I went to the restaurant as a nice date. The staff was very helpful in picking a wine to drink, and was very prompt with our orders. The food was amazing. My girlfriend had salmon, and continues to talk about how excellent it was. I had the petite bone-in filets, and they were delicious as well. For dessert the staff again recommended a port wine to go with the chocolate cake. The cake itself was incredibly rich, almost a fudge-like consistency. We will definitely return to this restaurant in the future.

column4: 7627 Culebra Ste 107 San Antonio, TX  78251
column13: The restaurant was quaint and vibrant but the waitress was not very informative and friendly. The crawfish etouffee had no crawfish and the dish was taken back to the kitchen for problem to be remedied. The burgers were ordinary. The pudding and pork belly were very good. The ambience and live music were good.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Airport)
column4: 7720 Jones Maltsberger Concord Plaza San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: Ruth Chris is my favorite place to dine and i've recommended this restaurant to family, friends and collegues. The food and service is superb...

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Downtown)
column4: 1170 E. Commerce Street Sunset Station St. Paul Square San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The service and food were exceptional! My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The rose petals, dessert and photo were pleasant surprises! Thank you for a memorable evening.

column4: 4035 N Loop 1604 W, Ste 102 San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: Great food and great service as always. Really like the ability to make reservations online.

column4: 434 N.Loop 1604 West San Antonio, TX  78232
column13: Silo is a never miss for great food and service!! If you don't go you are missing out! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I've been to Mark's in Houston!!

column4: 1133 Austin Hwy San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: we have not had a bad meal at Silo's. We went as a group of 4 and everyone's food was fantastic! I had Mahi Mahi over risotto. It was cooked perfectly. My husband had sea bass with soba noodles. He loved it! Our friends had the pork shank which was so tender it fell off the bone and the chicken over garlic mashed potatoes. For dessert, my husband and I got the chocolate mousse which fabulous. Our friends got the coconut cream pie and the creme brulet. The pie serving was huge! All of us tasted it. It was the creamiest coconut pie I have ever had! The chocolate mousse is still my favorite. We think this restaurant is a hidden gem. We are so glad it is so close to us!The waitstaff is friendly and attentive to special requests

column4: 999 East Basse,Suite 130 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: The only problem I had was that it was too loud!! We were screaming across the table to have a conversation.

column4: 5807 Worth Pkwy San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: Flatbread rocks

column4: 1201 N Loop 1604 W #101 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Always great food and great friendly staff.

column4: 203 South Saint Mary's San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The staff obviousky enjoys working there and their good mood influences the atmosphere in the restaurant. Our server was a sake fan and gave us good suggestions. Their rolls are creative, some influenced by cajun cuisine. Would definitly recommend.

column4: 999 E. Basse Road Ste. 186 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Sushi Zushi is our go-to option when we don't feel like making dinner. Food is good, consistent, and servers are always nice, we've never had a problem. I will say the Lincoln heights location is usually pretty noisy which is good if you have a group. One dissapointing dish we ordered, which doesn't happen much, was an appetizer of seared tuna crusted with pepper. Came with little hint of pepper and none of the sauce that was supposed to be on it, and was a pretty small portion.

column4: 17103 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: very small portions...... appetizers are about the same size as entree's.......expect a flavor explosion.....service is inexperienced but learning quickly.

column4: 401 S. Alamo San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Very innovative Italian, the chef is staying true to Italy, but using his ingredients very imaginatively. Absolutely delicious. Unusual to have such good food near a very touristy area of town.

column4: 1834 NW Loop 1604 San Antonio, TX  78248
column13: Very good as always but a little expensive and little plates. It was very dark, need more light.

column4: 207 North Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: We were delighted to see the friendly staff and vibrant atmosphere of this restaurant. We had reservations and were seated immediately. That was especially appreciated considering we had just spent 2.5 HOURS waiting for our entrees at the Chart House (which never arrived), so we stormed out of there and our next stop was Zinc! Our server was very friendly, our drinks never went empty and we spent the remainder of our anniversary at a place that knows how to provide good service. We didn't eat anything, but based on what we could see being served, it looked to be very good. When we left, any staff member we passed on our way out thanked us for coming in. This is what excellent service looks like. Chart House could take a lesson from Zinc!

column4: 420 W. Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: I brought my 9 year old daughter to San Antonio for her birthday and she wanted Italian food. We reserved a table on OpenTable. The waitstaff were incredible, attentive and polite. I mentioned this was her birthday trip and they appeared with a piece of tiramisu with a candle on a stone slab that had Happy Birthday written in chocolate! My daughter was delighted that our " grown up " dinner out ended with this special touch.They even accommodated her picky eating and deconstructed the spaghetti with plain pasta in a dish, sauce in another dish and a bowl of meatballs, which she proceeded to give a thumbs up to and ate them all. My whitefish over gnocchi was very good as well. Thanks to all for a nice evening.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Ste 25100 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: This was our first time at Z Tejas. The service, atmosphere and food were excellent! Love the variety on both the food and drink menus. We will definitely go back!
